changes.description:
Standardize input names across all the Controller blueprints. If you plan to update this blueprint, please update the inputs in your automations as follows:
- `remote` -> `controller_device`
- `zigbee2mqtt_remote` -> `controller_entity`
- `helper_last_loop_event_input` -> `helper_last_controller_event`
Add support for the Cover Hook.
Fix double press events not being detected with deCONZ.
Fix deCONZ events not being recognized.
Make `helper_last_controller_event` a mandatory input to simplify setup and enable future advanced features. Provide a dedicated input_text entity for this input when updating.
ðŸŽ‰ Add Debouncing support to avoid duplicate action runs.
Prevent undesired endless loops by running loop actions a finite number of times, configurable through a new blueprint input.
Fix inputs wrongly marked as required.
Fix Zigbee2MQTT reporting null state changes.
Standardize blueprint structure and input naming across the collection. Improve blueprint documentation. No functionality change.
Optimize characters usage for the `helper_last_controller_event` text input.
Fix double press events not triggered due to changes in Home Assistant 2023.5.x.

Migrate to Zigbee2MQTT MQTT Device Triggers. The `controller_entity` input is deprecated and `controller_device` is now mandatory. Remove `controller_entity` from your automation and configure `controller_device` with your controller device ID. (Thanks [@yarafie](https://github.com/yarafie))
Standardize input naming format for controller devices and virtual button actions. No functionality changes.

Add native double press triggers and refactor the blueprint to use triggers and trigger IDs. The integration selector input is removed, and `helper_last_controller_event` is no longer required. Re-download the blueprint and reconfigure existing automations to apply the changes. (Thanks [@yarafie](https://github.com/yarafie))
Double press events are now natively supported.
